alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 7:53PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central Minnesota and southeast North Dakota, including the following counties, in west central Minnesota, Clay. In southeast North Dakota, Cass. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 753 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fargo, Moorhead, West Fargo and Dilworth.
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
